definition: to float up/to rise to the surface/fig. to rise in the world
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: 16-18 He came to the surface, swam to shore, and went back to the villa to wait for his mother.
sentences.chinese: 他浮上了水面，游到海边，回到别墅里等妈妈。

sentences.english: The Huntley surfaced, signalled her success, and was never heard from again.
sentences.chinese: 亨特利号浮上水面，发出成功信号，但从此再无音信。

sentences.english: If so, just allow that energy to come up and allow it to pass through.
sentences.chinese: 如果有的话，就让那股能量浮上表面离开吧。

sentences.english: He let go of the rock and went up into the air. He saw that the sun was low.
sentences.chinese: 他放开了石头，浮上水面。他看见太阳已经低了

sentences.english: A smile came over rich dad's face.
sentences.chinese: 一丝笑容浮上了富爸爸的面庞。

sentences.english: We swam a long way under water and then came up for air.
sentences.chinese: 我们在水下潜游了很长一段路，然后浮上水面透口气。

sentences.english: The experiment on the modified clay's ability of holding back floating-dispersing oil in the water has been studied.
sentences.chinese: 进行改性粘土截留水中浮上分散态油的土柱实验研究。

sentences.english: That floats on high o'ver vales and hills.
sentences.chinese: 飘飞于长空，浮上峡谷和山峦。

sentences.english: She went up to the sea. The princess saw a great ship.
sentences.chinese: 这一天她浮上海面看见了一艘大船。

definition: to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
to flash through (one's mind)/to dodge (away from pursuers)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
